publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-337 Mr Kenny MacAskill: Lothian and Borders Police Force—That the Parliament recognises the additional strain put on the resources of Lothian and Borders Police Force and its serving officers as a result of the Parliament and the seat of government being in the city of Edinburgh; notes the additional roles and requirements for the service in the city as a result of its capital city status including, inter alia, policing the greater number of foreign consulates, providing security for increased visits from VIPs and royalty and maintaining order at many more demonstrations; further notes the representations made by the Chief Constable in his submission to the Scottish Executive on "The Case for Capital City Status", and calls for recognition to be given to these particular and special needs and requirements for the Lothian and Borders police service in the city of Edinburgh. Supported by: Fiona Hyslop*, Mr Rob Gibson*, Jim Mather*, Brian Adam*, Tricia Marwick*, Ms Sandra White*, Mike Pringle*, Mrs Margaret Ewing*, Margo MacDonald*
